pageContext.claim: “We got rid of the individual mandate, which was the key to Obamacare, but the most unpopular thing, where you pay a lot of money for the privilege of not having good health care for -- and just a disaster.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump's tax cut -- which he falsely calls the biggest ever --included a provision that reduced the tax penalty for not buying health insurance to zero -- the mandate actually still exists -- but it was never a lot of money. The penalty was relatively small and many health-care experts thought it should have been higher. For people who bought insurance on the Obamacare exchanges and qualified for subsidies, the monthly premiums were generally under $100. Trump often falsely says this move ended Obamacare to suggest he kept his promise to repeal the Affordable Care Act. But the law remains intact and has popular support. Moreover, it turned out the mandate was not an especially important motivator for people to buys health insurance.
